text.__SUMMARY__: Phyllanthus polyspermus is a bush species first described Jean Louis Marie Poiret, with its current name after Schumacher and Thonning; it is included in the family Phyllanthaceae.  No subspecies are listed in the Catalogue of Life.Note: this species is frequently misidentified as P. reticulatus (which occurs in Asia and was introduced to Jamaica).
